alert.note: Alert for Imperial Valley; Palo Verde Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Freeze Warning issued January 10 at 1:43AM PST until January 10 at 8:00AM PST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM MST /8 AM PST/ THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Temperatures in the lower 30s. * WHERE...Parker Valley, Central La Paz County, Aguila Valley, Gila River Valley, Tonopah Desert, Cave Creek/New River, Fountain Hills/East Mesa and West Pinal County. * WHEN...Through 9 AM MST/ 8 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
